item.title: Ticket #177 (Smilies should have their own class.) updated
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description: Count my vote for this feature too. Currently, I have to modify vars.php every time I upgrade WordPress.

item.title: Ticket #481 (Show the most recent N posts text is misleading) updated
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description:
Agreed.

This also affects archive listings. For example, visiting /year/monthnum/ or /year/ will display only the first N posts in that month or year respectively. (Where N is the number specified in the "Show most recent" setting)

item.title: Ticket #494 (PHP in Static Pages) created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description:
It should be possible for advanced users to include PHP and WordPress functions in their static pages.

Currently, it's impossible to easily create a separate "Archives" page, for example, which lists all the available posts under monthly headings.

Creating a specialized (and separate) PHP page is inappropriate, since it doesn't integrate with WordPress' Theme and Template support.

item.title: Ticket #492 (mysql2date does not get weekday/month abbreviations from locale) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
The mysql2date function (wp-includes/functions.php) does not use the $month_abbrev and $weekday_abbrev arrays, but instead gets the first 3 characters of the day/month name. In English, of course, it works quite perfectly, but when using localized month/date names there are two problems:

1) In some languages the abbreviations are much or less different (not exactly 3 symbols, not exactly the first three and so on)

2) substr is not unicode safe. As a result we get the first three bytes but, when the string is in utf8 I get the first character and a half :)

item.title: Ticket #491 (Theme editor. 23/11 nightly) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Say I have 2 themes. Theme A and theme B.

And i have Theme A active/selected.

If i use the theme editor to edit Theme B while Theme A is the selected one, when i save a file, it says "Sorry, that file cannot be edited." But the file is actually saved and edited.

Same thing happens if Theme B is active, and i'm trying to edit a theme A file.

item.title: Ticket #487 (upgrade.php crash) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
Let me guess: you have Scripty Godess' Subscribe To Comments-plugin running, have you? Deactivate it and it won't happen!

This is a matter of renaming functions and has to be done either by Scripty Goddess or within the WP-core.

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) updated
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description:
The tags in "additional information" up there got swallowed, but is shows that monospaced font gets lost on the way... ;-)

Here's the example again:

<pre>[pre] line with textp</p>

<p>[p]line with text pre</pre>

edited on: 11-24-04 12:14

edited on: 11-24-04 12:15

item.title: Ticket #488 (convert linebreaks breaks pre-tag formattting) created
item.dc:creator: bronski
item.description: When posting something within pre-tags that has empty lines those empty lines get padded with p-tags by the wpautop-filter. First, this breaks XHTML because it closes tags that haven't been opened and opens tags that never get closed, and second, after the p-tags font is not monospaced as it should be within pre-tags.
